content.question: A certain company produces fidget spinners with ball bearings made of either plastic or metal. Under standard testing conditions, fidget spinners from this company with plastic bearings spin for an average of 2.7 minutes, while those from this company with metal bearings spin for an average of 4.2 minutes. A random sample of three fidget spinners with plastic bearings is selected from company stock, and each is spun one time under the same standard conditions; let <math alttext="x bar sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the average spinning time for these three spinners. A random sample of seven fidget spinners with metal bearings is selected from company stock, and each is likewise spun one time under standard conditions; let <math alttext="x bar sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the average spinning time for these seven spinners. What is the mean <math alttext="mu subscript, x bar sub 1 minus x bar sub 2, end subscript" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> of the sampling distribution of the difference in sample means <math alttext="x bar sub 1 minus x bar sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 times 2.7 minus 7 times 4.2 equals negative 21.3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2.7</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>4.2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>21.3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 2.7 over 3, end fraction, minus the fraction 4.2 over 7 equals 0.3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4.2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.8: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Means

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
